summary: This is a superseding indictment from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with eight criminal counts related to her role in Jeffrey Epstein's sexual exploitation of minor girls. The indictment details a conspiracy spanning from approximately 1994 to 2004, alleging Maxwell recruited, groomed, and facilitated the abuse of multiple victims as young as 14, and later committed perjury in a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, sex trafficking, and perjury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser who, with Maxwell's assistance, sexually exploited multiple minor girls at his various residences.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the superseding indictment as the U.S. Attorney and is listed as the foreperson.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to entice and transport minor girls across state lines for the purpose of sexual abuse, with Maxwell managing his properties and facilitating access to victims.
Had an intimate relationship between approximately 1994 and 1997, and a close personal and professional association through 2004.
Maxwell met, groomed, and participated in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1, including in group encounters with Epstein, and enticed her to travel between Florida and New York.
Maxwell interacted with and groomed Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico in 1996, providing an unsolicited topless massage and encouraging her to massage Epstein.
Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to provide massages knowing they would lead to sexual abuse.
Maxwell met, groomed, and facilitated the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-4 in Palm Beach, paid her for encounters, and encouraged her to recruit other underage girls.

events.title: Conspiracy to Entice and Transport Minors
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, transporting them across state and international lines to Epstein's various residences.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein befriended, groomed, and sexually abused Minor Victim-1, including group sexual encounters, and enticed her to travel from Florida to New York for abuse.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited topless massage to Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico ranch and encouraged her to massage Epstein.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged massages that led to Epstein sexually abusing her.

events.title: Sex Trafficking of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein recruited Minor Victim-4 for paid sexual encounters at the Palm Beach residence, paid her in cash, and encouraged her to recruit other underage girls.

events.title: Perjurious Deposition Testimony
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and denied interacting with minors at his properties.

events.title: Additional Perjurious Testimony
events.description: In a subsequent deposition, Maxwell falsely denied knowledge of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, denied giving massages, and denied awareness of Epstein's sexual activities with others.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with eight counts including conspiracy, enticement of minors, transportation of minors, sex trafficking, and perjury.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of at least four minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1 through -4) for Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 1994 to 2004.
Victims were as young as 14 years old and were abused at Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell and Epstein allegedly created a network where victims were paid hundreds of dollars per encounter and were encouraged to recruit other underage girls.
Maxwell committed perjury during a 2016 civil deposition by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, her interactions with minors, and her own participation in massages and sexual activities.
